page.title: 02The Street
page.content: Many buildings here are the legacy of Jerimiah James Colman, the great Norwich "Mustard King" who once lived in the village. Nearly all the Colman buildings have the initials J.J.C. on them plus the year of construction. All the Colman houses were properly sewered and had running water, this in a rural community before 1900 was very remarkable and farsighted.The bungalow opposite the Chapel (c. 1880) was former servants quarters and laundry,and Nos. 21 and 23 typical estate workers cottages of 1896. The Village Hall is quite a centre for village life and activity, with many groups meeting here regularly. It was built in 1890, and Gladstone, who was a friend of Colman and visiting here, gave the clock which is inside the Hall.
